title: Emerald Polki Jadau Jhumka - 'Panna Kalika'
materials: Hyderabadi Polish for a luxurious shine.
features: Exquisite Jadau craftsmanship. The earring features a central oval cabochon emerald surrounded by a halo of uncut Polki diamonds. The design flows from a diamond-studded square and triangle to a floral motif at the base. The open setting enhances the brilliance of the Polki diamonds. Handcrafted with meticulous detail, showcasing the rich heritage of Hyderabadi jewelry making. The floral motif is reminiscent of 'kalika' designs, a symbol of auspiciousness and new beginnings.
colors: Predominantly gold with the vibrant green of the emerald and the sparkling white of the Polki diamonds.
occasions: and special occasions requiring a touch of traditional elegance.
description: A timeless masterpiece embodying the richness of South Indian jewelry heritage. The combination of Emerald and Polki diamonds is considered highly auspicious. The Hyderabadi craftsmanship ensures exceptional quality and durability. Each Polki diamond is unique, adding to the rarity and value of the piece. The 'Kalika' design element symbolizes prosperity and good fortune. This piece offers a perfect blend of traditional artistry and contemporary elegance.
